intro: [WRONG START] Clematis tibestina, commonly known as the Tibesti clematis, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the Tibesti Mountains in Chad. It is characterized by its woody stems and showy, palmate leaves that are adapted to withstand extreme desert conditions. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Its roots are deep and extensive, allowing it to access limited water resources in its harsh environment. Clematis tibestica is a rare and resilient species, showcasing unique adaptations to its challenging habitat.
